
```{r}
library(naniar)
library(ggplot2) # naniar builds on ggplot2

# Sample dataset with missing values
data <- data.frame(
  ID    = 1:8,
  Name  = c("Alice", "Bob", "Charlie", "David", "Eve", NA, "Grace", "Henry"),
  Age   = c(25, NA, 30, 28, NA, 35, 29, NA),
  Score = c(90, 85, NA, 88, 92, 80, NA, 75)
)

data

```

```{r}
# 1Visualize missingness across the whole dataset
vis_miss(data)


```


```{r}
#  Show missing value counts per variable in a bar plot
gg_miss_var(data)


```

- vis_miss() → Gives a matrix-style view of missingness for each variable and observation.

- gg_miss_var() → Gives a variable-level bar chart of NA counts, useful for quickly spotting problematic columns.

```{r}
# numerical summary for missing
miss_var_summary(data)
miss_case_summary(data)
```

```{r}
# statistical test for missing
mcar_test(data)
```
- The null hypothesis is that the data is MCAR
- The alternative hypotheis is that the dat is not MCAR
